2017-09-16|accessdate= 2017-10-15}} * The film uses archive footage from ''[[Logan (film)|Logan]]'', showing {{WP|Dafne Keen}} as [[Laura (Earth-17315)|Laura]] along with the rest of the [[Transigen Experiments (Earth-17315)|X-23 Children]]. However in ''Logan'' the children were created by the [[Alkali Corporation (Earth-17315)|Alkali Corporation]] and the footage shown was set in 2029, while in ''The New Mutants'' the [[Essex Corporation (Earth-10005 Revised)|Essex Corporation]] are the ones attempting to control the kids and if ''The New Mutants'' was set in 2029 or later the main characters of the film would have been born too late, since it's confirmed that on [[Earth-17315]] that the last mutant was born in 2004. As a result, the Laura seen is a [[Laura (Earth-10005 Revised)|version of the character]] that's native to [[Earth-10005 Revised]]. | Trivia = * {{WP|Rosario Dawson}}, who portrayed [[Claire Temple (Earth-199999)|Claire Temple]] in the [[Earth-199999|Marvel Cinematic Universe]], was originally reported to be in talks for the role of Dr. Cecilia Reyes.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/x-men-spinoff-new-mutants-cast-rosario-dawson-talks-star-1003192|title=Rosario Dawson in Talks to Star in X-Men Spinoff 'New Mutants'|last=Kit|first=Borys|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=25 May 2017|accessdate=01 June 2017}} * {{WP|Jon Hamm}} was originally planned to make a brief appearance in the film as [[Nathaniel Essex (Earth-10005 Revised)|Mister Sinister]], but said plans were scrapped in favor of introducing the character in the now canceled film ''Gambit'',{{cite web|url= https://www.ign.com/articles/x-men-mister-sinister-gambit-movie-villain-channing-tatum-fox|title= X-Men: Mister Sinister Was Supposed to Debut in Channing Tatum's Gambit Movie|work= IGN|last= Schedeen|first= Jesse|date= May 27, 2020|accessdate= August 19, 2020}} with the role and scene subsequently replaced by {{WP|Antonio Banderas}} portraying a different villain.{{cite web|url=http://www.tracking-board.com/inside-the-drama-surrounding-foxs-new-mutants-including-a-top-secret-new-cast-member-exclusive/|title=Inside the Drama Surrounding Fox's "New Mutants," Including a Top Secret New Cast Member (Exclusive)|last=Sneider|first=Jeff|work=The Tracking Board|date=30 March 2018|accessdate=31 March 2018}} ** Said role for Banderas, as [[Emmanuel Da Costa (Earth-10005 Revised)|Emmanuel Da Costa]], was planned to be introduced in a post-credits scene setting up a planned sequel, which would've been the second in a planned trilogy of films. These plans were scrapped due to Disney's acquisition of the X-Men film rights.{{cite web|url= https://ew.com/movies/the-new-mutants-sequel-antonio-banderas/|title= Exclusive: The New Mutants sequel would've starred Antonio Banderas|work= EW.com|last= Romano|first= Nick|date= March 11, 2020|accessdate= August 18, 2020}}{{cite web|url= https://theplaylist.net/josh-boone-new-mutants-interview-20200820/|title= Josh Boone Details How Fox-Disney Merger Affected ‘The New Mutants’ & How Movies Are “An Essential Service” [Interview]|work= The Playlist|last= Shaffer|first= Marshall|date= August 20, 2020|accessdate= February 2, 2021}} * [[Warlock]] was featured in early drafts of the film's script, but was scrapped due to being deemed too expensive for the film by Fox. * This film marks the last one in the ''X-Men'' film property made by 20th Century Fox, with the property returning to Marvel Studios following Disney's acquisition of Fox in March 2019. * According to the co-writer and director Josh Boone, this film was planned to be the first in a trilogy of films. The second film would've introduced [[Karma]], Warlock, and Antonio Banderas portraying Emmanuel Da Costa as a member of the [[Hellfire Club]]. While the third film would've introduced Darkchilde, and been a crossover with the main ''X-Men'' films, adapting the ''[[Inferno (Event)|Inferno]]'' storyline.{{cite web|url= https://collider.com/the-new-mutants-sequel-trilogy-plans-details-josh-boone/|title= ‘The New Mutants’ Director Wants His Trilogy to Conclude with an ‘Inferno’ Adaptation|work= Collider|last= Chitwood|first= Adam|date= July 23, 2020|accessdate= February 2, 2021}}{{cite web|url= https://www.comicbookmovie.com/x-men/new_mutants/new-mutants-3-wouldve-introduced-darkchilde-crossed-over-with-the-main-x-men-films-exclusive-a177671|title= NEW MUTANTS 3 Would've Introduced Darkchilde & Crossed Over With The Main X-MEN Films - EXCLUSIVE|work= ComicBookMovie.com|author= KingPatel|date= August 19, 2020|accessdate= February 2, 2020}} According to Boone, after the Disney acquisition, any scenes that were setting it up got cut during post-production. ==Gallery== ===Alternate Posters=== The New Mutants (film) poster 002.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 001.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 004.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 005.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 006.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 007.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 008.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 009.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 005 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 006 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 007 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 008 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 009 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 003 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 010 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 011 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 012 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 013 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 014 textless.jpg The New Mutants (film) poster 015 textless.jpg ===Videos=== ====Trailers==== The New Mutants Official Trailer HD 20th Century FOX The New Mutants Official Trailer 20th Century FOX The New Mutants Coming to Comic Con At Home July 23 at 2pm | Links = *[[Marvel Films#Theatrically Released Films|Marvel Films]] }} [[es:The New Mutants (película)]] [[ru:Новые мутанты (фильм)]] [[pl:Nowi Mutanci (film)]] [[Category:20th Century Fox]]
